instruction.en:
# Pairing
Step 1: Remove the remote from previous zigbee network if it has already been added to it, otherwise pairing will fail. Please refer to the part "Factory Reset Manually".
Step 2: Press and hold down "Prog." button until LED indicator turns on.
Step 3: Immediately short press "S1" button to search nearby network, indicator flashes every 1 second, 20 seconds timeout if there is no network. Indicator will then blink 5 times quickly for successful pairing.

# Factory Reset Manually
Step 1: Press and hold down "Prog." button until LED indicator turns on.
Step 2: Immediately short press 5 times "Prog." button continuously, indicator flashes 3 times quickly to indicate successful reset.

Press and hold down both buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Pair button on the top right corner and the remote will be set to pair mode.
The LED indicator blinking several times will indicate successful inclusion.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down both buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Pair button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

Press and hold down both Reset and Pair buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Pair button on the top right corner and the remote will be set to pair mode.
The LED indicator blinking several times will indicate successful inclusion.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down both Reset and Pair buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Reset button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

Press and hold down both Reset and Pair buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Pair button on the top right corner and the remote will be set to pair mode.
The LED indicator blinking several times will indicate successful inclusion.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down both Reset and Pair buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Reset button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

Short press the knob 5 times continuously.
Within 2 seconds press and hold the knob for over 3 seconds, indicator flashes every 1 second. Indicator will then blink 5 times quickly for successful pairing.

Remove the switch from previous ZigBee network if it has already been added to it, otherwise pairing will fail.
Short press the knob 5 times continuously and quickly.
Within 2 seconds press and hold the knob for over 3 seconds, indicator will flash 3 times for successful reset.

Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release the button and immediately press the Pair button and the remote will be set to pair mode.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release the button and immediately press the Reset button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

Press and hold down both Reset and Pair buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Pair button on the top right corner and the remote will be set to pair mode.
The LED indicator blinking several times will indicate successful inclusion.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down both Reset and Pair buttons until the LED indicator turns on.
Release both button and immediately press the Reset button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

# Pairing
Step 1: Remove the device from previous zigbee network if it has already been added to, otherwise pairing will fail. Please refer to the part "Factory Reset Manually".
Step 2: From your ZigBee Controller or hub interface, choose to add lighting device and enter Pairing mode as instructed by the controller.
Step 3: Re-power on the device to set it into network pairing mode (connected light flashes twice slowly), 15 seconds timeout, repeat the operation.
Step 4: Connected light will blink 5 times and then stay solid on, then the device will appear in your controller's menu and can be controlled through controller or hub interface.

# Factory Reset Manually
Step 1: Short press “Reset.” key for 5 times continuously or re-power on the device for 5 times continuously if
the “Prog.” key is not accessible.
Step 2: Connected light will blink 3 times to indicate successful reset.

# Pairing
Short press button K2 5 times continuously (Or reset power of the device for 5 times continuously).

# Factory reset
Short press button K2 5 times continuously (Or reset power of the device for 5 times continuously).

# Pairing
Step 1: Remove the device from previous zigbee network if it has already been added to, otherwise pairing will
fail. Please refer to the part "Factory Reset Manually".
Step 2: From your ZigBee Controller or hub interface, choose to add lighting device and enter Pairing mode as instructed by the controller.
Step 3: Re-power on the device to set it into network pairing mode (connected light flashes twice slowly), 15 seconds timeout, repeat the operation.
Step 4: Connected light will blink 5 times and then stay solid on, then the device will appear in your controller's menu and can be controlled through controller or hub interface.

# Factory Reset Manually
Step 1: Short press "Reset." key for 5 times continuously or re-power on the device for 5 times continuously if the "Prog." key is not accessible.
Step 2: Connected light will blink 3 times to indicate successful reset.

Quickly press the Reset button on the device 5 times or repeatedly power OFF/ON 5 times to make the device into pair mode. The device slowly flashing means the device is in pair mode. The pair mode generally lasts for 15 seconds after each power on. Re-power the device to enter pair mode again.

Quickly press the Reset button on the device 5 times or repeatedly power OFF/ON 5 times to make the device into pair mode. The device slowly flashing means the device is in pair mode. The pair mode generally lasts for 15 seconds after each power on. Re-power the device to enter pair mode again.

Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release button and immediately press the Pair button and the remote will be set to pair mode.
The LED indicator blinking several times will indicate successful inclusion.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release the button and immediately press the Reset button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release button and immediately press the Pair button and the remote will be set to pair mode.
The LED indicator blinking several times will indicate successful inclusion.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release the button and immediately press the Reset button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

Press and hold down both buttons until LED indicator turns on. 
Immediately short press pair button to search nearby network, indicator flashes every 1 second, 20 seconds timeout if there is no network. Indicator will then blink 5 times quickly for successful pairing. 

Remove the remote from previous zigbee network if it has already been added to it, otherwise pairing will fail. 
Press and hold down both buttons until LED indicator turns on. Immediately short press pair button 5 times continuously, indicator flashes 3 times quickly to indicate successful reset.

Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release button and immediately press the Pair button and the remote will be set to pair mode.
The LED indicator blinking several times will indicate successful inclusion.

Reset...
When you can't successfully add a device, reset the device first.
Press and hold down the Reset button until the LED indicator turns on.
Release the button and immediately press the Reset button 5 times and the remote will be reset.

Press and hold down both buttons until LED indicator turns on. 
Immediately short press pair button to search nearby network, indicator flashes every 1 second, 20 seconds timeout if there is no network. Indicator will then blink 5 times quickly for successful pairing. 

Remove the remote from previous zigbee network if it has already been added to it, otherwise pairing will fail. 
Press and hold down both buttons until LED indicator turns on. Immediately short press pair button 5 times continuously, indicator flashes 3 times quickly to indicate successful reset.

Press and hold down reset button until LED indicator turns on. 
Immediately short press pair button to search nearby network, indicator flashes every 1 second, 20 seconds timeout if there is no network. Indicator will then blink 5 times quickly for successful pairing. 

Remove the remote from previous zigbee network if it has already been added to it, otherwise pairing will fail. 
Press and hold down reset button until LED indicator turns on. Immediately short press reset button 5 times continuously, indicator flashes 3 times quickly to indicate successful reset.

Press and hold down reset button until LED indicator turns on. 
Immediately short press pair button to search nearby network, indicator flashes every 1 second, 20 seconds timeout if there is no network. Indicator will then blink 5 times quickly for successful pairing. 

Remove the remote from previous zigbee network if it has already been added to it, otherwise pairing will fail. 
Press and hold down reset button until LED indicator turns on. Immediately short press reset button 5 times continuously, indicator flashes 3 times quickly to indicate successful reset.

Quickly press the Reset button on the device 5 times or repeatedly power OFF/ON 5 times to make the device into pair mode. The device slowly flashing means the device is in pair mode. The pair mode generally lasts for 15 seconds after each power on. Re-power the device to enter pair mode again.

Quickly press the Reset button on the device 5 times or repeatedly power OFF/ON 5 times to make the device into pair mode. The device slowly flashing means the device is in pair mode. The pair mode generally lasts for 15 seconds after each power on. Re-power the device to enter pair mode again.

Quickly press the Reset button on the device 5 times or repeatedly power OFF/ON 5 times to make the device into pair mode. The device slowly flashing means the device is in pair mode. The pair mode generally lasts for 15 seconds after each power on. Re-power the device to enter pair mode again.

# Pair
Triple press the reset button.

!!! NOTE
Wait 5 - 10 seconds after each pairing operation, otherwise pairing will easily fail.

# Factory Reset
Press and hold the reset button for over 10 seconds.

# Pair
Press and hold down both buttons I and O for over 3 seconds.

!!! NOTE
Wait 5 - 10 seconds after each pairing operation, otherwise pairing will easily fail.

# Factory Reset
Press and hold down both buttons I and O for over 10 seconds.

hint.en:
1. Send Command Class Device Reset Locally Notification V1 to associated devices of this group to report factory reset information when factory reset the remote control.
2. When remote control battery power value changes, send Command Class Battery Report V1 to associated devices of this group to report power value information.
3. Short press or press and hold down any button to send scene activation command to the associated devices of this group using Command Class Central Scene Notification V3

1. Short press / button of Group 2 to send ON/OFF command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Basic Set V2.
2. Press and hold down / button of Group 2 to send light intensity increase/decrease command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Multilevel V4.
3. Short press Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Activation Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.
4. Press and hold down Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Conf Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.

1. Short press / button of Group 3 to send ON/OFF command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Basic Set V2.
2. Press and hold down / button of Group 3 to send light intensity increase/decrease command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Multilevel V4.
3. Short press Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Activation Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.
4. Press and hold down Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Conf Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.

1. Short press / button of Group 4 to send ON/OFF command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Basic Set V2.
2. Press and hold down / button of Group 4 to send light intensity increase/decrease command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Multilevel V4.
3. Short press Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Activation Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.
4. Press and hold down Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Conf Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.

1. Short press / button of Group 5 to send ON/OFF command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Basic Set V2.
2. Press and hold down / button of Group 5 to send light intensity increase/decrease command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Multilevel V4.
3. Short press Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Activation Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.
4. Press and hold down Scene button S1/S2, direct control of associated devices using Scene Conf Set, Scene ID = 0x10 / 0x20.

instruction.en:
# Pair
Press and hold down both buttons over 3 seconds.

!!! NOTE
Wait 5 - 10 seconds after each pairing operation, otherwise pairing will easily fail.

# Factory Reset
Press and hold down both buttons together for over 10 seconds.

hint.en:
1. Send Command Class Device Reset Locally Notification V1 to associated devices of this group to report factory reset information when factory reset the remote control.
2. When remote control battery power value changes, send Command Class Battery Report V1 to associated devices of this group to report power value information.
3. Short press or press and hold down any button to send scene activation command to the associated devices of this group using Command Class Central Scene Notification V3

Short press on/off button to send ON/OFF command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Basic Set V2.

Press and hold down brightness button to send light intensity increase/decrease command to associated devices of this group using Command Class Multilevel V4.

instruction.en:
# Pairing
Press and hold down both I and O buttons over 3 seconds.

!!! NOTE
Wait 5 - 10 seconds after each pairing operation, otherwise pairing will easily fail.

# Factory Reset
Press and hold down both I and O buttons together for over 10 seconds.

2. When remote control battery power value changes, send Command Class Battery Report V1 to associated devices of this group to report power value information.

instruction.en:
# Pair
Triple press the action button.

!!! NOTE
Wait 5 - 10 seconds after each pairing operation, otherwise pairing will easily fail.

# Factory Reset
Press and hold down action button for over 10 seconds.

hint.en:
1. When factory reset the sensor, send Device Reset Locally Notification CC to associated devices of this group to report factory reset information.
2. When the sensor state changes, send NOTIFICATION CC to associated devices of this group.
3. When the battery power is low, send BATTERY CC to associated devices of this group.
When the sensor is turned on/off, send BASIC_SET. It can be configured by configuration parameter 02 to send BASIC=0XFF(ON), BASIC=0X00(OFF) or disable this function.

instruction.en:
# Pair
Triple press the action button on the smart plug.

!!! NOTE
Wait 5 - 10 seconds after each pairing operation, otherwise pairing will easily fail.

# Factory Reset
Press and hold down action button for over 10 seconds.

hint.en:
1. Smart plug Factory Reset, send Command Class Device Reset Locally Notification CC to associated devices of this group to report factory reset information when factory reset the smart plug.

2. Smart plug overloads, send Command Class NOTIFICATION_REPORT CC to associated devices of this group to report overload information.

3. When smart plug state changes, send Command Class SWITCH_BINARY_REPORT CC to associated devices of this group to report state information.

4. METER_ REPORT

instruction.en:
# Pairing
Triple press the action button.

!!! NOTE
Wait 5 - 10 seconds after each pairing operation, otherwise pairing will easily fail.

# Factory Reset
Press and hold down the action button for over 10 seconds.

hint.en:
1. When press and hold down “Reset” button for 10S to reset the switch, send "Device Reset Locally Notification CC" to associated devices of this group to report factory reset information.
2. When load state changes, send "Basic Report CC" to associated devices of this group.
3. When over temperature is detected, send “Emergency shutoff status" to Lifeline.

instruction.en:
# Pair
1) At OFF mode (Off icon), press and hold up and down buttons at the same time for over 5 seconds to enter Settings Menu.
2) Short press move up and down button to select a settings item, then short press button F to enter selected item.
3) Select "Add", then short press button F.

# Factory Reset
Enter settings item, select "Reset", then short press button F.

hint.en:
1.Send Command Class DEVICE_RESET_LOCALLY_NOTIFICATION to associated devices of this group when factory reset the device.
2.Send Command Class THERMOSTAT_SETPOINT_REPORT, THERMOSTAT_MODE_REPORT, THERMOSTAT_OPERATING_STATE_REPORT to associated devices of this group When operation mode and temperature change.
3.Send Command Class NOTIFICATION_REPORT to associated devices of this group when over current, over heat detected
4.Send Command Class METER_REPORT to associated devices of this group to report metering parameters.

Transfer Command Class THERMOSTAT_SETPOINT_SET THERMOSTAT_MODE_SET
to control other temperature control devices when operation changes

3. When over temperature is detected, send “Emergency shutoff status" to Lifeline.
